messages.message:
Based on very large documents, the initial capacity may not be sufficient - we have a change in progress to increase this, to target 24.14 release.
Apart from this once you share the converse project id and approx timing when you tried to digitize, we can take a look to investigate further.
Do we have any concrete guidance on the how large a document we can handle currently? @Rakesh

We have tested upto ~~400~  550 pages on single doc in Prod without any issues for single doc cases. Its more with any large parallel workloads that come up and autoscaling capacity.  Once Josh shares more details on the specific case here, I will pull in auto scaling team for any tuning changes that are required for parallel workloads with large docs.
Thanks @joshbronko - I am going to trace your last digitization with these files in logs - it was on Apr 4th (date of posting thread here) that you saw the failure ?
This was also leading into list and table extaction failure as well for these documents
Few of excel files are `.xlsm` files which are not supported for processing, were you trying to upload these in Build or Converse ?
just the PDF, i just provided all from the samples

Thanks, so PDF files in this set are ranging with 3, 5, 12, 8, 145. Frankly collectively also this is less than 200 pages across all documents. So it looks like some other issue if the digitization with object detection failed on only these documents. I will investigate further.
